column1: NAME        Anthocyanin biosynthesis - Ipomoea nil (Japanese morning glory)

DESCRIPTION Anthocyanidins (aglycones) and anthocyanins (glycosides) are common plant pigments and belong to a structural subclass of flavonoids characterized by a 2-phenylbenzopyrylium unit. They are derived along the flavonoid modification pathways and further separated into three types
column5: due to the different number of hydroxyl groups in the phenyl group.

column1: CLASS       Metabolism; Biosynthesis of other secondary metabolites
